_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The ten qualities that serve as protecto: Ethical conduct, restraint in the code of conduct, good behavior, and supporters
Being very learned, remembering and keeping what theyâ€™ve learned
Having good friends, companions, and associates
Being easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish
Being deft and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for their spiritual companions
Loving the teachings and being a delight to converse with, being full of joy in the teaching and training
Living with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities
Being content with any kind of robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick
Being mindful, having utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago
Being wise, having the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
